title: Phenomenological Inquiry into Quantum Physics: Developing Conceptual Understanding and Descriptive Approaches

context.prior_knowledge: Foundations of classical physics, wave/particle duality, and basic quantum mechanics concepts
context.additional_context: Students must demonstrate concept application skills through project-based assessments, requiring real-time interaction using digital devices

learning_goals: Students can describe quantum phenomena from three or more distinct perspectives using phenomenological analysis methods
Learners can explain core concepts of quantum physics (e.g., the uncertainty principle) by connecting them to real-world phenomena (e.g., microscopic systems)
Participants can refine their conceptual descriptions using operational/independent approaches based on peer feedback
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
